entry.title: Man of Tomorrow
entry.summary:
Author: clumsycanon

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,157Chapters: 7/12Kudos: 27

Summary: Clark Kent always wanted to be a hero.When Vought calls after his viral rescue, he says yes. Yes to the suit, the fame, the Seven. Yes to the spotlight he’s spent his whole life hiding from.But under the surface of glittering galas and carefully staged interviews, something darker simmers—inside the tower, inside Homelander’s smile, inside himself.And then there’s Bruce Wayne: billionaire, enigma, walking contradiction. The only person who sees Clark—not just Superman. Not just the symbol.But even Bruce has secrets. And when an impossible robot drops from the sky glowing with something that hurts Clark in ways he’s never known, everything begins to crack.Clark must face who he is. Kal-El. Clark Kent. Superman.Alien. Weapon. Hope.The truth is out there.And it might just break them all.~~~~~~A Superman x The Boys fusion where Clark joins the Seven, falls for Bruce Wayne, and unravels everything he thought he knew—about Vought, about Krypton, and about himself.

entry.title: 𝑪𝑳𝑶𝑺𝑬 𝑸𝑼𝑨𝑹𝑻𝑬𝑹𝑺 // 𝑨 𝑺𝑼𝑷𝑬𝑹𝑩𝑨𝑻 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑹𝒀
entry.summary:
Author: battinscnz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,009Chapters: 10/?Kudos: 186

Summary: Bruce Wayne is no stranger to the spotlight—or the shadows it casts. Reclusive, haunted by tragedy, and heir to a name that carries more weight than comfort, he now faces something far more personal than public scrutiny: a stalker. The letters arrive like clockwork—taunting, obsessive, familiar. And with Halloween approaching—the anniversary of his parents' death—the tension coils tighter.Clark Kent is a disciplined, quietly intense MMA-trained security specialist, brought in under General Sam Lane’s orders to keep Bruce safe. He expects a job. He doesn’t expect the gothic cold of Wayne Manor, the brooding silence of its only resident, or the unsettling depth of what Bruce refuses to say out loud.But as danger creeps closer, and the mystery surrounding the stalker sharpens, Bruce and Clark are forced into uncomfortable proximity. What begins as resistance slowly becomes something deeper—something fragile and real.

entry.title: What Remains When the Monument Falls
entry.summary:
Author: Hasunohana

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,930Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 35

Summary: The Batcave had always held secrets, but none as raw as Jason Todd’s memorial—a shrine of glass and grief, a monument to the son Bruce Wayne had failed.Now, with the Batfamily closer than ever, Bruce decides it’s time to let go of the past. When Jason is summoned to the manor, he braces for the same old cycle of guilt and discord. Instead, he finds his father standing before the memorial, tools in hand, ready to shatter that symbol of pain once and for all.As the glass fractures, Jason is forced to confront the question that’s haunted him since he clawed his way out of the grave:Who is he now——when he’s no longer the dead Robin,—no longer the failed vigilante?

entry.title: We Could Be Heroes - A SuperBat Love Story
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 99,107Chapters: 34/?Kudos: 200

Summary: Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent both maintain a strong sense of justice and fight for peace in their respective cities. However, both are struggling to maintain order alone, and are weighed down by a lost sense of identity and the loneliness that stems from the isolation of living a double life. After a chance encounter, the pair agree to form a Justice League to address the growing threat to Earth's security. As they learn to work together, new feelings blossom, and the heroes soon find themselves leaning on each other for support and comfort.Slow-burn romance. Bat-family drama. Justice League shenanigans. Bruce being a rich kid with issues. Superman being an innocent lad.Heavily inspired by Batman/Superman The Animated Series, Justice League, and Justice League Unlimited. Also takes inspiration from The Batman (2022), My Adventures With Superman (2023), Batman: Caped Crusader (2024), Smallville (2001), Batman (1966), and various comics, including the World's Finest and Public Enemies series.

entry.title: As Though the Sun Will Never Set
entry.summary:
Author: Scarlet609

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 118,519Chapters: 9/65Kudos: 239

Summary: Bruce Wayne has done something to get him sent to live with the Kents, he thought it would be mundane and unfulfilling, but he soon finds himself caught between something dangerous and wonderful. There are factions moving in to claim his prize, his newly found trump card and he's not ready to let it go.Enter Clark, the soft-spoken Kansas farm boy, just a little too wholesome, a little too comfortable with cows and crickets and just a little too strong for his own good.As Bruce enters the plotters and begins weaving his web of seduction and treachery, mundanity seems further and further away, slipping through Clark's fingers.ORThe one in which they are both trapped and enslaved by Clark's growing sexual desire and his alien physiology. entry.title: Intertwined, sewn together
entry.summary:
Author: holmes_heartmo0n

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,066Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 40

Summary: Bruce and Clark have been dating for years now, they've been through a lot together as Bruce taking on Gotham as his field of vengeful justice and Clark taking on the mantle of Superman. They even adopted a child together.But Bruce wanted more, longed for more.And he had a plan to do it, if only he had the courage to implement it.
